class.name: Phaser.Animation

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.help: A reference to the owner of this Animation.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The unique name for this animation, used in playback commands.

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.help: The FrameData object that contains all frames used by this Animation.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.help: An array of numbers or strings indicating which frames to play in which order.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.help: The speed at which the animation should play. The speed is given in frames per second.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Should this animation loop when it reaches the end or play through once.

class.help: An Animation instance contains a single animation and the controls to play it.\nIt is created by the AnimationManager, consists of Animation.Frame objects and belongs to a single Game Object such as a Sprite.

public.name: complete
public.help: Called internally when the animation finishes playback.\nSets the isPlaying and isFinished states and dispatches the onAnimationComplete event if it exists on the parent and local onComplete event.

public.name: destroy
public.help: Cleans up this animation ready for deletion. Nulls all values and references.

public.name: generateFrameNames
public.help: Really handy function for when you are creating arrays of animation data but it's using frame names and not numbers.\nFor example imagine you've got 30 frames named: 'explosion_0001-large' to 'explosion_0030-large'\nYou could use this function to generate those by doing: Phaser.Animation.generateFrameNames('explosion_', 1, 30, '-large', 4);

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.help: The start of the filename. If the filename was 'explosion_0001-large' the prefix would be 'explosion_'.

parameters.name: start
parameters.help: The number to start sequentially counting from. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' the start is 1.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.help: The number to count to. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' the stop value is 34.

parameters.name: suffix
parameters.help: The end of the filename. If the filename was 'explosion_0001-large' the prefix would be '-large'.

parameters.name: zeroPad
parameters.help: The number of zeroes to pad the min and max values with. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' then the zeroPad is 4.

public.name: next
public.help: Advances by the given number of frames in the Animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: The number of frames to advance.

public.name: onPause
public.help: Called when the Game enters a paused state.

public.name: onResume
public.help: Called when the Game resumes from a paused state.

returns.help: - A reference to this Animation instance.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.help: The framerate to play the animation at. The speed is given in frames per second. If not provided the previously set frameRate of the Animation is used.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Should the animation be looped after playback. If not provided the previously set loop value of the Animation is used.

parameters.name: killOnComplete
parameters.help: If set to true when the animation completes (only happens if loop=false) the parent Sprite will be killed.

public.name: previous
public.help: Moves backwards the given number of frames in the Animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: The number of frames to move back.

public.name: restart
public.help: Sets this animation back to the first frame and restarts the animation.

public.name: setFrame
public.help: Sets this animations playback to a given frame with the given ID.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.help: The identifier of the frame to set. Can be the name of the frame, the sprite index of the frame, or the animation-local frame index.

parameters.name: useLocalFrameIndex
parameters.help: If you provide a number for frameId, should it use the numeric indexes of the frameData, or the 0-indexed frame index local to the animation.

public.name: stop
public.help: Stops playback of this animation and set it to a finished state. If a resetFrame is provided it will stop playback and set frame to the first in the animation.\nIf `dispatchComplete` is true it will dispatch the complete events, otherwise they'll be ignored.

parameters.name: resetFrame
parameters.help: If true after the animation stops the currentFrame value will be set to the first frame in this animation.

parameters.name: dispatchComplete
parameters.help: Dispatch the Animation.onComplete and parent.onAnimationComplete events?

public.name: update
public.help: Updates this animation. Called automatically by the AnimationManager.

public.name: updateFrameData
public.help: Changes the FrameData object this Animation is using.

parameters.name: frameData
parameters.help: The FrameData object that contains all frames used by this Animation.

public.name: currentFrame
public.inlineHelp: The currently displayed frame of the Animation.

public.name: delay
public.inlineHelp: The delay in ms between each frame of the Animation, based on the given frameRate.

public.name: enableUpdate
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets if this animation will dispatch the onUpdate events upon changing frame.

public.name: frame
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the current frame index and updates the Texture Cache for display.

public.name: frameTotal
public.inlineHelp: The total number of frames in the currently loaded FrameData, or -1 if no FrameData is loaded.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: isFinished
public.inlineHelp: The finished state of the Animation. Set to true once playback completes, false during playback.

public.name: isPaused
public.inlineHelp: The paused state of the Animation.

public.name: isPlaying
public.inlineHelp: The playing state of the Animation. Set to false once playback completes, true during playback.

public.name: killOnComplete
public.inlineHelp: Should the parent of this Animation be killed when the animation completes?

public.name: loop
public.inlineHelp: The loop state of the Animation.

public.name: loopCount
public.inlineHelp: The number of times the animation has looped since it was last started.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: The user defined name given to this Animation.

public.name: onComplete
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when this Animation completes playback. If the animation is set to loop this is never fired, listen for onAnimationLoop instead.

public.name: onLoop
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when this Animation loops.

public.name: onStart
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when this Animation starts playback.

public.name: onUpdate
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when the Animation changes frame. By default this event is disabled due to its intensive nature. Enable it with: `Animation.enableUpdate = true`.

public.name: paused
public.inlineHelp: Gets and sets the paused state of this Animation.

public.name: speed
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the current speed of the animation in frames per second. Changing this in a playing animation will take effect from the next frame. Minimum value is 1.

private.name: _parent
private.inlineHelp: A reference to the parent Sprite that owns this Animation.
